Sorry I'll explain better in English, adding on Moutaz Shams's answer

Do we have a software market? Yes

Do Arabs at large or Egyptians in specific produce commercial quality software products? Yes

Where are these people? Not anywhere within a 10 mile radius.. No for real though, once they start smelling like hot potential they're booted out of the region.

Are we the best? No

Why? Many reasons most people wont like hearing but can be summed in that most are lazy and unprofessional

Why are most people lazy and unprofessional? Because most lack the incentive to become better

Why? Because like any economic market, a healthy one is determined by a few criteria one of the most critical is proper demand.

We. Do. Not. Have. Proper. Software. Demand. Believe it or not, that's really how simple the problem by definition is. The solution is an order of magnitude complicated. Maybe the subject of another post/comment.

The industry in Egypt is a bit wider than you already know. It's just not getting any better because everyday we're losing more trained experienced calibre than we're injecting into the market.

It's too soon for you to feel this level of frustration, it's understandable but not justifiable. It's not that grim, not today anyway. Maybe 5-6 years ago.

My advice is, don't worry about it now. If you have an interest in a certain segment of the industry then focus on it. Just keep in mind, the more interesting the segment is, the harder it'll be to find many others sharing the same interests here as such less work.

Egyptian software market is simply dull and unentertaining. But it's there.

Good luck.

i love programming, after if finished college, i worked for a small startup in cairo, i found what we are working on is really boring and makes me hate programming and like Hady Ahmed said you don't have to be professional to sell software in egypt, so we forgot about it :D
i found that i really enjoy programming when i work on my own projects.
if you really like programming, make your goal to work in a professional company, like google, i mean try to be good as google engineers, this is very hard, i can say that 90% of egyption programmers don't know even the road to this.
my advice for you 
- know the field you like most (back end, front end, network, database, games ,...) even every one of them has a lot of branches in it
- know you way to it, you can just ask good programmers on the IRC or something, what to do to be professional in X?
- work on hard problems, this is very important

for me i quit my job, and i decided that if i stayed in egypt i will work in the ERP field, because of the money of course :D, and will keep programming as my hoppy

wish you the best
